channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chipotle’s CEO says the company will absorb any price increases as tariffs on Mexico are set to hit 50% of its avocado supply
item.description: Scott Boatwright didn’t rule out that prices could rise if costs become a “significant headwind.”

item.title: European Leaders Look for Allies to Secure Ukraine-Russia Peace Deal
item.description: European leaders met in London to formulate a plan to help end the war in Ukraine. But even potential peacekeepers face political and economic hurdles...

item.title: Billionaire investor Ray Dalio warns the U.S. won’t ‘be competitive in manufacturing with China in our lifetime’
item.description: The Bridgewater Associates founder argued China will continue to have the edge in producing applications for AI chips compared to the U.S.

item.title: A Black Studies Curriculum Is (Defiantly) Rolling Out in New York City
item.description: Educators are embracing rather than restricting discussions of race in schools. Leaders have said they’ll do so whether the Trump administration appro...

item.title: Andrew Cuomo Declares His Run for NY Mayor With a Message for Democrats
item.description: Attacking the Democratic Party’s leadership as he declared his candidacy to run the nation’s largest city, he clearly had a wider audience, and his ow...

item.title: Home sellers are ‘waking up to reality’ and are slashing prices to combat stubbornly high mortgage rates
item.description: Realtor.com’s chief economist predicts “further price softening” for the spring.

item.title: Drones Now Rule the Battlefield in the Ukraine-Russia War
item.description: Drones have changed the war in Ukraine, with soldiers adapting off-the-shelf models and swarming the front lines.

item.title: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent sees inflation plummeting to the Federal Reserve’s 2% target despite Trump’s tariffs
item.description: Bessent blamed “four years of disastrous policies,” for scorching inflation, claimed the current administration was working everyday to lower prices, ...

item.title: Zelensky Turns to Diplomacy in a War With ‘a Long Way to Go’
item.description: After a startling clash with President Trump, who has echoed the Kremlin view of the war, Ukraine’s leader is trying to shore up European support and ...

item.title: Why Demi Moore’s Oscar Loss to Mikey Madison Stings for Some Fans
item.description: Moore had been considered a favorite for her strong performance in “The Substance,” but Madison won for “Anora.”

item.title: European Leaders Look for Allies to Secure Ukraine-Russia Peace Deal
item.description: European leaders met in London to formulate a plan to help end the war in Ukraine. But even potential peacekeepers face political and economic hurdles...

item.title: Industries Brace for Trump Tariffs Taking Effect on Tuesday
item.description: President Trump could still choose to pause the tariffs he is threatening to put on America’s largest trading partners Tuesday, but industries are pre...

item.title: Pope Experiences Another Setback With Respiratory Crisis
item.description: The Vatican said that Monday’s crisis was caused by a significant accumulation of mucus in his bronchial tubes.

item.title: At Least Two Killed After Car Rams Crowd in Mannheim, Germany
item.description: The police in Mannheim, in the country’s southwest, said that the driver, a 40-year-old German citizen, had been arrested and that they did not believ...

item.title: XRP and Solana soar then falter as Trump announces plans for a multi-asset crypto reserve
item.description: The president said that XRP, SOL and ADA will be included in a national crypto stockpile with Bitcoin and Ethereum.
